intro: Elachyptera micrantha, commonly known as the small-flowered ironwood, is a flowering plant native to parts of Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pink flowers that appear in clusters, typically during the spring and summer months. Its leaves are narrow and leathery, providing a dense canopy that offers habitat for various wildlife. Elachyptera micrantha is often found in dry, rocky areas and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
